content:
You really need to add a line in the calculation steps that 
S2(0,k) = 0 and S2(n,0) = 0.

My code was giving 11 for the first test until I looked up the definition on Wikipedia and saw this was missing from yours.

I just got this clash, and I do not understand it. Probably I overlook something.

What is S2(2,0) (for example)? I needed it for my approach in simply finding first all S2 for n=1-25 and k=1-25. Then, at some point, I need to know S2(3,1), and S2(3,1) is calculated partly based on S2(3-1,1-0) = S2(2,0).
-- or can I in that case consistently base S2(2,0) partly on S2(1,-1) -- which is 1 because n is 1 in that case? [oh shit that is probably it]

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This was fun and it's a reasonable challenge for Clashes.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice puzzle for a clash.
